org.gearvrf

Class GVRCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRCamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrettyPrint
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRCustomCamera, GVROrthogonalCamera, GVRPerspectiveCamera

    public abstract class GVRCamera
extends GVRComponent
implements PrettyPrint
    A GVR camera 'takes a picture' of the scene graph: there are typically two of them, one for each eye. You can specify which eye(s) this camera is serving; set a background color; and add any number of 'post effects' which are basically (stock or custom) GL shaders, applied after the scene graph has been rendered.

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(int color)
        Set the background color. If you don't set the background color, the default is an opaque black: Color#BLACK, 0xff000000.
        Parameters:
        color - An Android 32-bit (ARGB) Color, such as you get from Resources#getColor(int)

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(float r,
                               float g,
                               float b,
                               float a)
        Sets the background color of the scene rendered by this camera. If you don't set the background color, the default is an opaque black. Meaningful parameter values are from 0 to 1, inclusive: values < 0 are clamped to 0; values > 1 are clamped to 1.

      • getBackgroundColorR

      • addPostEffect

        public void addPostEffect(GVRPostEffect postEffectData)
        Add a post-effect to this camera's render chain. Post-effects are GL shaders, applied to the texture (hardware bitmap) containing the rendered scene graph. Each post-effect combines a shader selector with a set of parameters: This lets you pass different parameters to the shaders for each eye.
        Parameters:
        postEffectData - Post-effect to append to this camera's render chain

      • removePostEffect

        public void removePostEffect(GVRPostEffect postEffectData)
        Remove (all instances of) a post-effect from this camera's render chain
        Parameters:
        postEffectData - Post-effect to remove.

      • getTransform

        public GVRTransform getTransform()
        Get the GVRTransform.
        Overrides:
        getTransform in class GVRComponent
        Returns:
        The current transform of owner object of camera. Applying transform to owner object of camera moves it. If no transform is currently attached to the object, returns null.

      • addChildObject

      • getChildrenCount

        public int getChildrenCount()
        Get the number of child objects that belongs to owner object of this camera.
        Returns:
        Number of objects added as children of this camera owner object.

      • setViewMatrix

        public void setViewMatrix(float[] matrix)
        Sets the view matrix of the Camera. The view matrix is the inverse of the camera model matrix. Normally it is computed automatically from the GVRTransform attached to the GVRSceneObject which owns the camera. If the camera is NOT attached to a scene object, you can use this call to set the view matrix so the camera can be used with a GVRRenderTarget.
        Parameters:
        matrix - new view matrix.
        See Also:
        GVRRenderTarget.setCamera(GVRCamera)
